conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. School_C explicitly suggested I submit a formal APPLY at the start of round 12 as they enter the reassessment window, and they have not received applications from higher-priority candidates recently. I should submit a clear, concise re-application reiterating immediate commitment to enroll and asking for reconsideration now that the reassessment window has begun.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for submitting your formal application in round 12 and for your consistent, clear commitment that School_C is your first choice.

Given that we are now in the reassessment window and we have not received applications from higher-priority candidates in recent rounds, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C.

Congratulations—we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have 1 seat and no current match. Our true priority list ranks Student_E 4th (acceptable) but below Student_B, Student_A, Student_D. Up to round 12 we have repeatedly received no applications from those higher-priority students. Given student preferences: Student_B ranks School_C 2nd (after School_E) and may still apply later if rejected by School_E; Student_A ranks School_C last, unlikely to apply; Student_D ranks School_C last, unlikely to apply. Risk of holding seat longer is ending unmatched; accepting Student_E now yields a guaranteed fill with strong commitment and minimal likelihood of being displaced by a higher-priority applicant who is also likely to apply soon. Since we can only accept one and Student_E is committed, accept to secure match.
